H0.text: Epidermal cells form the single layer that covers the rest of the root above the meristem, and they may have root hairs.

H1.text: Dermal is the type of cells that cover the rest of the root above the meristem in a single layer, and these cells may have root hairs.

H2.text: Single celled cells cover the rest of the root above the meristem, forming a single layer that may have root hairs.

H3.text: Vegetative cells cover the rest of the root above the meristem in a single layer and may bear root hairs.

A4.text: Root hairs or absorbent hairs, are outgrowths of epidermal cells, specialized cells at the tip of a plant root.
